intro: Casearia poeppigii, commonly known as the white casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
